meanings.definition: Excessively particular or fastidious in taste or standards.
meanings.sent1: She is very finical about the way her clothes are folded.
meanings.sent2: The chef's finical taste made him a master at creating exquisite dishes.
meanings.sent3: The finical cat refused to eat any food that wasn't served in its favorite bowl.
meanings.sent4: Her finical nature when it comes to choosing colors for her paintings sets her apart from other artists.
meanings.sent5: The finical princess would only wear dresses made from the finest silk and lace.

meanings.definition: Showing or requiring great attention to detail.
meanings.sent1: The finical architect spent hours perfecting every tiny detail of the building.
meanings.sent2: His finical work on the model ship made it look incredibly realistic.
meanings.sent3: The finical detective noticed a small detail that led to solving the case.
meanings.sent4: Her finical eye for design transformed the plain room into a stylish space.
meanings.sent5: The finical tailor meticulously sewed each button onto the coat with precision.

meanings.sent1: The finical child refused to eat anything green on his plate.
meanings.sent2: Her finical attitude towards cleanliness made her room spotless at all times.
meanings.sent3: The finical dog would only sleep on a bed with a specific blanket.
meanings.sent4: His finical behavior at the restaurant annoyed his friends.
meanings.sent5: The finical customer returned the product because the packaging was slightly damaged.
